title: Control Structures - Making Decisions and Repeating Actions
description: Learn how to make your programs smart by using if statements, loops, and decision-making structures
learningOutcomes: Understand conditional statements (if, else if, else)
Learn different types of loops (for, while)
Apply logical operators in decision making
Create programs that respond to different conditions
Combine control structures to solve complex problems

sections.title: What are Control Structures?
sections.content: Control structures are like traffic lights for your code - they control which parts of your program run and when. Just like you make decisions every day ("If it's raining, I'll take an umbrella"), programs need to make decisions too!

sections.title: Making Decisions with If Statements
sections.content: If statements let your program choose what to do based on different conditions. Think of them as asking yes/no questions and doing different things based on the answer.

examples.title: Simple If Statement
Weather Decision

sections.title: Multiple Conditions with Else If
sections.content: Sometimes you need to check multiple conditions. That's where 'else if' comes in handy - it's like having a chain of questions to ask.

examples.title: Grade Calculator

sections.title: Logical Operators - Combining Conditions
sections.content: Sometimes you need to check multiple things at once. Logical operators help you combine conditions using AND (&&), OR (||), and NOT (!).

examples.title: Movie Theater Rules

sections.title: For Loops - Repeating with a Counter
sections.content: For loops are perfect when you know exactly how many times you want to repeat something. It's like saying "Do this 10 times" or "Count from 1 to 100".

examples.title: Counting to 5
Multiplication Table
examples.content:
# Create a multiplication table for 3
for i in range(1, 11):
    result = 3 * i
    print(f"3 x {i} = {result}")

# Output:
# 3 x 1 = 3
# 3 x 2 = 6
# 3 x 3 = 9
# ... and so on

sections.title: While Loops - Repeating Until a Condition Changes
sections.content: While loops keep running as long as a condition is true. They're like saying "Keep doing this until something changes".

examples.title: Guessing Game
Countdown Timer
examples.content:
countdown = 5

while countdown > 0:
    print(f"Countdown: {countdown}")
    countdown = countdown - 1

sections.title: Nested Control Structures
sections.content: You can put control structures inside other control structures! This is called nesting, and it lets you create more complex decision-making.
